document.docAuthor: Mauro-Barr, T. T., Carvalho, R. A., Felix, M. & Mejdalani, G.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of the Neotropical leafhopper genus Exogonia with description of seven new Brazilian species (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Cicadellini)

paragraph.keyLead: 1. Dorsum with pair of pale yellow stripes extending from crown to apical cells of forewings ( Figs 28, 29 , 66, 68 ) .... 2

4. Subgenital plates abruptly narrowed toward apex on basal half ( Fig. 71 ); connective stalk broad ( Fig. 72 ). ............... ..............................................................
E. hyalinosparsa (Melichar, 1932)
, in part ( Paraná and Espírito Santo states)
- Subgenital plates gradually narrowed toward apex ( Figs 12 , 23 , 42 ); connective stalk narrow ( Figs 13 , 24 , 43 )....... 5

5. Aedeagus with small dorsoapical process ( Fig. 25 ).
.................................. E. longinqua
sp. nov.
( Mato Grosso State )

E. hyalinosparsa (Melichar, 1932)
, in part ( Paraná and Espírito Santo states)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–8.
Exogonia capixaba
sp. nov.
, male holotype: (1) body, lateral view; (2) head, pronotum, and mesonotum, dorsal view; (3) pygofer, lateral view (illustrated mounted on a temporary slide with glycerin); (4) subgenital plate, ventral view; (5) connective and style, dorsal view; (6) aedeagus and basal portion of gonoduct, lateral view; (7) paraphyses, lateral view; (8) paraphyses, dorsal view.

taxonomicName.emphasis: Exogonia capixaba Mauro-Barr, Carvalho et Felix

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology. The specific epithet,
capixaba
, is from the indigenous language Tupi-Guarani and refers to the natives from Espírito Santo State , Brazil .

Type-material .
Brazil , Espírito Santo State .
Holotype
: male, “Rib.[Ribeirão] do Engano E.S.\ Vale do Itauna \ Trav.[Travassos] e Santos-9-10-42” ( MNRJ ).
